news.title: UltraTech Cement posts profit of ₹1,729.44 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: UltraTech Cement reported impressive figures for the December quarter of FY26, with net profits climbing to Rs 1,729.44 crore. The company experienced an uptick in revenue, driven by a 15 percent increase in sales volume. Capacity utilization soared to 77 percent, signaling operational efficiency.

news.title: Haryana human rights body orders action over illegal encroachment in Gurugram residential area
news.para: The Haryana Human Rights Commission has ordered Gurugram police and administrative officials to permanently clear illegal building material dumping.  The Commission noted ongoing issues despite previous actions.  Authorities are now mandated to build boundary walls, install fencing, CCTV, and lighting.

news.title: Housing drive aims to bring slum dwellers to mainstream: Karnataka CM
news.para: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced a large-scale distribution of houses to integrate slum dwellers into the mainstream. The government is dedicating over 42,000 houses under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. Siddaramaiah highlighted his government's commitment to fulfilling housing promises, contrasting it with central government contributions.

news.title: Greater Noida: 90 flats up for auction in Omicron
news.para: Greater Noida Authority will e-auction 90 constructed flats in Sector Omicron 1A on January 28, with reserve prices ranging from Rs 73.2 lakh to Rs 74.3 lakh. These 83.38 sqm carpet area units offer immediate possession and convenient access via a 130-meter road, benefiting aspiring homeowners and reducing rental burdens.

news.title: Illegal sand mining continues in Raichur; 37 cases booked in 19 days
news.para: Illegal sand mining persists in Raichur district, with 37 cases registered in early January, predominantly in Devdurg taluk. Allegations of political and police complicity fuel the ongoing menace, despite efforts by authorities and warnings of strict action against all involved.

news.title: DDA’s Nagrik Awas Yojana 2026 sparks row; buyers say Karamyogi flats overpriced
news.para: DDA launched Nagrik Awas Yojana 2026 with over 1,700 flats at a 25% discount, sparking discontent among government employees who applied for the Karamyogi Awas Yojana. Applicants allege significantly lower prices in the new scheme for comparable flats, creating a financial disadvantage for them.

news.title: MahaRERA orders Kalpataru Yashodhan's promoters to refund homebuyer with interest
news.para: MahaRera has directed Kalpataru Yashodhan promoters to refund over Rs 1.40 crore plus interest to a homebuyer couple. The promoters failed to deliver a flat booked in 2017 by the promised date. They then illegally forfeited the entire amount paid by the couple and sold the flat to another party. MahaRera ruled this forfeiture arbitrary and violative of Rera regulations.

news.title: Nearly 2,000 sand trucks ‘vanish’ in Ludhiana
news.para: Police have booked 13 suspects in Ludhiana for a massive Rs-9-crore heist involving the disappearance of 1 lakh tonnes of construction material. The alleged scam was uncovered during an audit at Legal India Limited, with nearly 2,000 truckloads of sand, gravel, and soil vanishing from records. Suspects are accused of destroying stock trails to facilitate the theft.

news.title: AIPL buys Gurugram land for Rs 1,000 crore through debt recovery tribunal
news.para: Realty developer AIPL has secured a 43-acre plot in Gurugram for Rs 1,000 crore. This acquisition, made through the debt recovery tribunal, resolves dues for six banks. The land will be used for a large township project on the Dwarka Expressway. The first phase, AIPL Lake City, has already launched with a revenue potential of Rs 1,500 crore.

news.title: Infra.Market gets Sebi nod to float IPO
news.para: Tiger Global-backed construction material supply firm Infra.Market proposed an IPO worth between Rs 4,500 crore and Rs 5,500 crore with market regulator Sebi using the confidential pre-filing route in October last year, market sources said.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government invites bids for phase II of Amaravati master plan
news.para: The state government is accelerating capital city development with phase II, launching a land pooling scheme for 16,000 acres. A master plan, including economic strategies, is being prepared by global consultants to guide land use, infrastructure, and zoning. This phase prioritizes a global sports arena and international airport, ensuring structured expansion and landowner benefits.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh government extends LRS application deadline to April 23, 2026
news.para: The Andhra Pradesh government has extended the deadline for its Layout Regularisation Scheme. Applications can now be submitted until April 23, 2026. This extension follows numerous requests from the public. The scheme aims to regularise plots across municipal areas. Funds collected will improve civic infrastructure. Unregularised plots will face restrictions.

news.title: Lucknow development body to develop luxury flats in Gomtinagar Extension
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority is launching Narmada Apartment in Gomtinagar Extension, offering 300 luxury 3BHK+study flats and 12 penthouses. Registrations open January 24th, with applications exclusively online. The project, priced from Rs 1.4 crore, will feature modern amenities and is expected to be completed in three years.

news.title: Nashik: Over 75,000 beneficiaries to get new homes on Republic Day
news.para: Nashik Zilla Parishad has facilitated the construction of over 75,000 homes, with 51,000 under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Rural) and 24,000 through state schemes. Beneficiaries, including vulnerable sections, will receive keys to their new homes on Republic Day, fulfilling the 'housing for all' dream in rural areas.

news.title: Builders flag e-khata delays, seek Greater Bengaluru authority’s intervention to reduce bottlenecks
news.para: Karnataka builders are facing significant delays in property registrations and project handovers due to e-khata and approval bottlenecks, even for projects with occupancy certificates. Credai Karnataka has urged for urgent intervention to streamline these administrative procedures. The sector also seeks revisions to affordable housing definitions and tax reductions to ease cost pressures.

news.title: Builders to pay ₹25,000 penalty for delayed quarterly reports: Karnataka RERA
news.para: Karnataka Rera will penalize real estate promoters Rs 25,000 per quarter for failing to submit project progress reports starting financial year 2025-26. Promoters have a final chance to submit overdue reports by February 20, 2026, without penalty. This move aims to protect homebuyer rights and ensure project transparency. Builders suggest penalties should be nominal, while homebuyers welcome the initiative.

news.title: Mumbai: Mhada to pay ₹200 crore to take back three of four vacant plots
news.para: Mhada will pay Rs 200 crore to re-acquire three plots linked to the Rs 1,039-crore Patra Chawl redevelopment scam, with the state cabinet approving the payment. This move is part of Mhada's consent terms filed before the High Court, aiming to resolve a contempt petition by builder Guruashish Constructions.
